content: ग्राम्य {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [ग्राम-यत्] {@--1@} Relating to or used in a village; <ls>Ms. 6. 3</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">7. 120.</ls> {@--2@} Living in a village, rural, rustic; अल्पव्ययेन सुंदरि ग्राम्यजनो मिष्टमश्नाति <ls>Chand. M. 1.</ls> {@--3@} Domesticated, tame (as an animal). {@--4@} Cultivated (<ab>opp.</ab> वन्य ‘growing wild’). {@--5@} Low, vulgar, used only by low people (as a word); चुंबनं देहि मे भार्ये कामचांडालतृप्तये <ls>R. G.</ls>, or कटिस्ते हरते मनः <ls>S. D. 574</ls>, are instances of ग्राम्य expressions. {@--6@} Indecent, obscene. {@--7@} Relating to sexual pleasures. {@--8@} Relating to a musical scale. --म्यः {@--1@} A tame hog. {@--2@} The first two signs of the zodiac, {%Aries%} and {%Taurus%}. --म्या The Indigo plant. --म्यं {@--1@} A rustic speech. {@--2@} Food prepared in a village. {@--3@} Sexual intercourse. {@--4@} Acceptance.
